name: Walt Hansgen
introduction: Walter Edwin "Walt" Hansgen (October 28 1919 - April 7 1966) was a driver from the United States. A veteran of World War II, after the war he was a notable test driver and successful road racing driver in the US, including four wins in the SCCA National Championships. Hansgen entered five Formula 1 races, qualifying in two, both at Watkins Glen. In 1964, he finished fifth in a factory Lotus-Climax, scoring two points.
